article: Last fall I put a bird feeder outside my window. I thought as soon as I hung up, a great  _  beautiful birds would come. Days, weeks and months went by;  _  , no birds. I asked many people, why? What was I doing  _  ? "Nothing," most of them replied. "Just  _  ." So I waited, waited and waited. I  _  off the deck , I changed the feed, I  _  the feeders, and I  _  made the cat go out the other door! But  _  seemed to work. So --- I waited, "with patience and hope. " Two months later, early in the morning, I was  _  . A beautiful bird had been on the bird feeder. All of a sudden, I saw hundreds upon hundreds of birds  _  from everywhere.  _  a beautiful lesson this living thing taught me! "Patience and hope" will  _  the most beautiful things in life. So I keep hoping and waiting, waiting and  _  . I will try to use this "little lesson" in  _  many other things in my life. I guess, "  _  is a virtue " after all.
